stepAnswer: $2,500 in the 3.2% account, $5,500 in the 8% account
stepTitle: Marco has $8,000 to save for his daughter’s college education. He wants to divide it between one account that pays 3.2% interest per year and another account that pays 8% interest per year. How much should he invest in each account if he wants the interest on the total investment to be 6.5%?
choices: $2,500 in the 3.2% account, $5,500 in the 8% account
$5,500 in the 3.2% account, $2,500 in the 8% account
$200 in the 3.2% account, $500 in the 8% account
